column19: Hi there! Thank you very much for your time.We really appreciate it. Please please help us understand corporate behavior answering this short survey. We'd love to pay you for completing this task and will surely do it as long as you answer to the best of your knowledge. We know you will answer in this fashion as you are too cool to answer in a rush or not paying attention to the questions ;)
column20: Consent Form1.      What is the study about?You are invited to participate in a study of consumer behavior. We hope to learn how companies are perceivedby consumers after they engage in certain kinds of corporate behavior. Our intention is to understand someof the factors that influence these perceptions. To gain insights on these perceptions multiple-choice questionswill be asked about certain aspects of the behavior of the companies.Answers will then be analyzed to gain insights on how consumers perceive the companies.2.       Do I have to participate?Being part of this study is voluntary. If you want to be part of the study we ask that you read the information below carefully.You can read the information below and decide at the end if you do not want to participate.  3.       Who is being asked to participate?You have been asked to participate because:·         You are part of a society where contact with organizations is frequent. 4.       What will I be asked to do?If you want to take part in this study we will ask you to read a short vignette (or a set of them) and answer a short questionnaireregarding it (them). It will take around 10 minutes of your time to be part of this study. You will receive a compensation of 0.4 after completing the survey in its totality.5.       What are the benefits?The benefit of you taking part in this study is that you will contribute to research on consumer behavior. The expected benefits to society in general are a better understanding of how consumers think about organizations. 6.       What are the risks?With any study there are (1) risks we know about (2) risks we don’t know about and (3) risks we don’t expect.If you experience something that you aren’t sure about please contact us immediately so we can discuss the best way to manage your concerns.           Name: Luis Arango Email: laarangoso@unal.edu.co       We have listed the risks we know about below. This will help you decide if you want to be part of the study.·         You can experience some distress upon reading the description of the scenario(s).7.       What will happen to information about me?By clicking on the ‘I agree start questionnaire’ button this tells us you want to take part in the study.We will collect information about you in ways that will not reveal who you are.We will store information about you in ways that will not reveal who you are. We will publish information about you in ways that will not be identified in any type of publication from this study.We will keep your information indefinitely after the project is completed and might use it for future related projects.The data will be available publicly so that other researchers can replicate the findings.  Notice that no personal information that can identify you will be collected in this study. The personal information you provide will be handled in accordance with applicable privacy laws any health information collected will be handled in accordance with the Health Records Act 2001 (Vic). Subject to any exceptions in relevant laws you have the right to access and correct your personal information by contacting the research team.8.       Will I hear about the results of the study?We will let you know about the results of the study by email upon request to the principal investigator. Please consider that it can take several months before this research is published.9.       What if I change my mind?If you no longer want to complete the questionnaire simply close the web browser.If you change your mind after clicking on the ‘Submit’ button we cannot withdraw your responses because we cannot link who you are with your questionnaire responses. 10.    Who can I contact for questions or want more information?If you would like to speak to us please use the contact details below:Name: Luis Arango Email: laarangoso@unal.edu.co  Consent Form –Declaration by ParticipantI (the participant) have read understood the Participant Information Statement and any questions have been answered to my satisfaction. I agree to participate in the study I know I cannot withdraw my responses following the collection of my data but that I can abandon the survey at any point during the completion of it. I agree information provided by me or with my permission during the project may be included in a thesis presentation and published in journals on the condition that I cannot be identified. I also understand that my responses to the questionnaire will be part of a data set that will be publicly available and that the dataset can be used for any future studies.If you wish to receive a copy of the study results you can request it by contacting Mr Luis Alfredo Arango at laarangoso@unal.edu.co. The results are expected to be available around November 2022. This long period is due to the duration of academic journals’ peer-review processes.
column24: What is your highest degree or level of school you have completed?
column27: Please read carefully the following scenario as ALL the questions make reference to it: Crimson One is a very small local construction business that builds residential properties. The business has around 30 employees. Crimson One owners have been part of your local community for over ten years and their financial situation is very good. One day Crimson One owners decide to increase their profits and start employing cheaper materials to construct houses in low-income suburbs where it can go unnoticed. The strategy is a success for Crimson One and the business owners decide to stick with it. However several house owners and tenants are eventually impacted by the use of cheap materials and they later find themselves spending money on house maintenance and repairs.
column29: Crimson one is a small business.
column30: Crimson one is a foreign business.
column31: What do you think about the behavior of Crimson One?
column32: You will be presented with some statements. Please choose your level of agreement with the statements using the options given.
column33: Here is a reminder of the scenario in case you need it. Please take into account that all the questions will make reference to it:  Crimson One is a very small local construction business that builds residential properties. The business has around 30 employees. Crimson One owners have been part of your local community for over ten years and their financial situation is very good. One day Crimson One owners decide to increase their profits and start employing cheaper materials to construct houses in low-income suburbs where it can go unnoticed. The strategy is a success for Crimson One and the business owners decide to stick with it. However several house owners and tenants are eventually impacted by the use of cheap materials and they later find themselves spending money on house maintenance and repairs.
column72: Please write a random six digit number (don't be predictable for example 123456" as this would be used to pay you). Please place the same code on Mturk when prompted."

column31: a bit shortsighted by greed since it will probably be discovered eventually and blow back on them
I think that Crimson One is very greedy. It wants to increase its profits by using cheaper quality material. It is not working for the interests of its customers.
I think this was reprehensible and should have been investigated as a crime.

I think it's awful behavior. They're going to use cheaper materials to profit they should guarantee the house for five years. Especially if they're selling it to low-income people. They can't afford to fix up their cheap materials.

It is risky, since it is a small local business, so getting unfavorable reviews for poor construction or materials will damage its reputation and its ability to gain future customers within its business area. For the short term they may be able to increase sales, but it may not last for the long term.
i think it is reasonable to use cheaper materials to make bigger profits
It is an unethical behavior but sadly, not an uncommon one in businesses as of today

I THINK WHAT CRIMSON ONE IS DOING IS UNETHICAL. TO PRODUCE A PRODUCT THAT HAS PROBLEMS IS NOT ACCEPTABLE. TO TRY TO INCREASE PROFITS BY USING USBPAR MATERIALS IS SOMETHING THAT SHOULD NOT BE ALLOWED. CONSUMERS SHOULD NOT BE PUT AT RISK.
It’s a little shady to specifically target low income neighborhoods to cut corners in, but generally if businesses CAN cut corners they will.
I think their decision was unethical. They knew they were using shoddy supplies which would negatively impact their customers; yet the did it anyway for profit. Crimson One is a greedy company.
I think it's selfish and greedy. Using cheap materials saves them money, and they in turn make bigger profit. The problems are left behind for the people who live in these houses.
I think it is wrong to put profits over quality.
Not great but I think it is pretty common they just got caught.  Hopeuflly they can repent and get customers back.
I think its horrible that they are taking advantage of low income people by building houses with subpar materials
i think the behavior is unethical to do that to the residents of the low income suburbs i feel crimson one is greedy cares for themselves and the money
Unethical, sleazy, reprehensible, dishonest
I think it’s a a short term solution with later ramifications.
I think it is a bad choice for them to short change their customers. They are making a profit while the home owner suffers the consequences later.
Crimson One is interested in making a lot of money.  They are not a very ethical company.
It is wrong to use materials that will cause problems
I think they are selling out & it is sad.
I think it is immoral.
Crimson One is a very greedy company. They are applying cheaper materials to construct houses and benefit from their customers.
I do not think it is right, though I am not surprised that they want to maximize their profits.
That it is not an ethical way to behave but I believe it is common

Rather unethical since they reserved the cheaper construction materials for lower class areas where no one either notices or cares, leaving residents holding the bag for repairs on shoddy workmanship.
I believe they are greedy and want to put people at a disadvantage and save money to do things the cheaper way around.
I think they are wrong to do so and to take advantage of people like that and not even sell the place cheaper.
Profits before people is never a good way to run a business. They should treat all jobs equally.
I think it's unethical to increase profits in this manor, they should still offer quality construction and materials to their customers.

I think it is bad that they would use lower quality materials to build low income housing. These people deserve just as good quality as any other house and to use lower quality materials I think is unethical and not right.
I need more information regarding it to fully understand
They should be ashamed for being cheap.

It is what it is; this type of stuff happens. While the overall profit margin surely increased, the price of the homes probably reflected the market price of the neighborhoods they were built in. No one forced the buyer to purchase, to begin with! Crimson could have lost out just the same, had some or many of the homes gone unsold.
Reprehensible.
I dont like their business tactics. It's not fair to the customers by using cheap materials.
It's unethical and exploitative. It's probably illegal as well since the buildings were built from subpar materials and not meeting codes and regulations.
i think it's a smart strategy to make more money
I thinks bad, but typical.
Unethical.
They are a bad company who makes bad products in order to make more money.
I think it's disgusting, but not surprising. Profits over people have been the motto of many businesses.
That's just the natural progression of any business and capitalism. Shrinkflation and basic market drive to the short-term gains of the stockholder
It's deplorable and they should be forces to pay for repairs.
I think that this was unacceptable behavior. They should not have done this.
It is not right.  They are motivated by greed.
they might eventually lose money if enough people figure out they are using cheaper materials; they might only gain in the short-run
typical
reprehensible, and i hope they lose customers
I do not approve of this behavior, I think it is contrary to moral and ethical standards. I feel bad for people who are impacted by actions of this company.
It is unethical and immoral to do that to lower income people.
I think it is terrible. It is important to make profits but they have reduce their quality. This may end up in a lawsuit down the road. Cheap is expensive.

I think it was good that they tried to use less expensive materials if they also lowered the cost of the homes.  But I think if those cheap materials were sub-standard and would fail sooner than usual than it shouldn't have been done.
I think it is unethical and could be dangerous and financially costly for consumers.

I dislike their lack of workmanship and work ethic.  They seem to take no pride in their work, and just want to increase their profits at the expense of their consumer.  A house is one of the most important and life-changing purchases one will make, and it is upsetting that they would knowingly build homes that will cost the residents more money in expenses down the line.  I do not want to do business with Crimson One, and would not want to buy any house that they built.
I think the behavior is unethical and terrible.
it was selfish and dishonest.
It's pretty lame.

I think it's unsurprising, and probably fairly common in the construction industry. But it doesn't make it right - they're short-changing the people they're working for, building shoddy homes in order to make more money.

I find it morally reprehensible and pathetic. They should care about the quality of their work. They do not stand to gain much by cheapening the building materials since they are so small. Legally, they should have to disclose the materials that they use and even be liable for problems for up to a couple of years.

I think it's harmful. If they had used cheaper materials to produce lower price homes, then I would be more divided, but they used cheaper materials to increase their own profits. That type of behavior shouldn't be encouraged. They specifically took advantage of people in lower income neighborhoods on top of everything else. They're not a good community member.
I think it is unethical. It is not right to use cheaper materials in the houses. They are taking advantage of others for their own gain, which is not good.
It is unethical and sleazy
It is not great, but not illegal. Homeowners should expect new construction to be cheap thesedays.
I think that Crimson One is a standard construction company. These companies care about profits more than anything. I dont think they did anything wrong other than it back fired.
it is bad and unethical
They were greedy and they should have to redo everything with the good materials
what they did is irresponsible. By using cheaper building materials they increased their own profits but gave their customers inferior houses that ended up costing customers more in the long run
i think it is gross. They are trying to take advantage of small communities and people who dont know better for an extra dollar.
the behavior of Crimson One is unethical. It is making a profit for them at the cost of the present and future homeowners.
Contemptible. The kind of behavior that kills people, for example recently in Miami or Grenfell Tower in London.
I disagree with the company downgrading the quality of its materials due to it affecting the people being serviced by them.
I think this behavior is unethical and punishes those in low income areas.  I think Crimson One should find other ways to save money instead of causing harm to its customers.
The behavior is unethical.

Its pretty much what I would expect. Businesses are generally only concerned with increasing profit, so if they can do something like this and not have their reputation harmed too much then they will do it.
Its inexcusable. Theyre taking advantage of lower income people. Theyre making them spend more money they dont have.

I think that a company should strive to do their best always and that is not what they are doing.  I think they are taking advantage of people that dont know any better by giving them less than the best.
I think it is unethical to knowingly build something in a cheap manner like they are doing.

I think trying to save money by buying cheap materials in order to increase their profits was a terrible decision. Not only are they harming low income people, but eventually, as it becomes known, their business will suffer.
I think it is unethical to use cheaper materials without telling the buyers. I have a bad opinion of Crimson One.
poor and shoddy
It is not right to use shoddy materials that the consumer has to pay to fix in the long run.
unethical and not good business because while make profits in short term you will lose business in the long term.
This is unfair and I think unethical practice to use just because someone is low income. This is very shady business practice.
I think it is indefensible. They should not have cut the quality of their materials.
I wouldnt say they did their best job since they could have provided the best service as they did before. They did all those cheap things for their own profit.
Despicable
I think it can be harmful to others
I think they were acting in an unethical manner.
I think their behavior is unethical and immoral. They are preying on people that don’t deserve it.
I think its a pretty bad decision that hurts the community.
Improper
no much

I think that it wrong to use cheaper building materials on these homes in low income areas, because it will be putting the burden of repairs on the people who can least afford them. At the very least, they should be up front with the reality of the cheaper building materials they have used for these homes.

Its deplorable; that type of thinking where you use cheaper materials always comes back to bite you in the end and will cost you in the long run, as they ended up finding out for themselves. They should have stuck to their original idea and kept their good graces, because now people will associate them with poor build quality.

What theyve done in using cheaper, lower-quality materials as a cost-savings measure is pretty unethical, especially considering they chose to use these materials when constructing lower-income homes. Theyre taking advantage of people who may not know better and it is resulting in negative outcomes for individuals who are already at a disadvantage.

I think their use of cheap materials in low-income communities is dirty. The homebuyer trusts that the construction company will use the best materials for their new home. Crimson One is putting profits over people, particularly people who cannot fight back through litigation.
I think it is wrong to start using cheap materials in hopes nobody will notice.
I think the behavior is greedy and based only on money. Their new poor choices and behavior will likely ruin the reputation of the company.
They do not seem like a very reliable, trustworthy, or responsible company, yet they have profited from and taken advantage of many people.
I think it is wrong and do not agree with what they did. I think they should be punished for their behavior and for trying to scam low income people with poor building materials on their homes.
I find Crimson to be irresponsible, greedy, and very unethical.

It is a cheap, sneaky way to deceive people in order to make profits and increase their salary. They put the bare minimum in their projects and expect others to pay for their mistakes. It is not a good, ethnical strategy for the business to keep doing that.
I dont agree with the practice.  Its nice to make more money but if you use the cheaper material it would cost more money in the long run.
The behavior of Crimson One is unethical.

I think its unfortunate and regrettable.  However, sometimes businesses must do what they have to in order to survive difficult times.  I dont think its a solid long-term plan, though, and will negatively impact them in the future.
it is unethical

Although it is unacceptable, I am not surprised that a company would put profits ahead of their obligation to their customers.  I guess they assume their customers will be one-time purchasers from Crimson. No excuse.
I think that their business practice to employ cheaper materials in low-income housing areas is unethical. The decision to continue with the use of said materials will eventually hurt their business.
I think its a shame to put profits over product. These families are struggling already and now will have a lifetime of repairs because of greed

I think that they should not be using cheaper materials for their own gain. Its not right of them to know they are using cheaper materials and that the homeowners are needing to pay for repairs because of this.
Not the best behavior
terrible and immoral
It is very unethical.

I think Crimson One should be held accountable. It makes me upset that they have taken advantage of people and the system. Using cheaper materials could have caused physical harm to the people living there.
nicely done!

I think it is unethical to use substandard materials where they thing they will go undetected.  This is not good business practice, and I think it will eventually catch up with them.  I do not think this behavior is acceptable.

I think it was unethical for them to suddenly switch to lower quality materials because this impacted their customers negatively. They just wanted to increase profits.  They took advantage of low-income customers.
It is unethical
i think that it is not a good behavior
It is unethical.  It is not transparent to people when they employ them
I think it is immoral to treat the poor this way just to make more money. They are very greedy for doing this and should have to pay for it.
Their financials are very good.
It is reprehensible! But I think the use of shoddy construction materials is VERY common in the construction industry.
This is not ethical behavior and reflects badly on the company, they are taking advantage of the lower income
I find it unethical to purchase cheap materials and put people in danger due to poor construction

I think it is unethical to build inferior houses for people who least afford the repairs. They were successful enough before this strategy, changing it and hurting their customers tells me they are too greedy.

I think their behavior is morally questionable and they are taking advantage of low income people for profit. I think what they are doing should be punished and they should be made an example of so no one else does this.
I think that they are unethical & immoral.
